<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Inventory
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Inventories are stated
	at the lower of cost or market value. Cost is determined using the &quot;moving average&quot; method. Inventory consists of raw
	materials, work in process and finished products. Inventory write-offs are provided to cover risks arising from slow-moving items,
	technological obsolescence, excess inventories, and for market prices lower than cost.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
<B>
<I>
	Valuation of Long-Lived Assets, Intangibles and Goodwill
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0 0 0 32.2PT; TEXT-INDENT: -0.25IN">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 0.25IN">
<B>
<I>
	(a)
</I>
</B>
</TD>
<TD>
<B>
<I>
	Tangible and Intangibles
</I>
</B>
<B>
<I>
	Long-Lived
	Assets
</I>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Intangible assets consist
	of brand names, customer related intangibles, and developed technology. Intangible assets are stated at amortized cost. Intangible
	assets are amortized over their useful life using a method of amortization that reflects the pattern in which the economic benefits
	of the intangible assets are consumed or otherwise used up.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Brand names are amortized
	over periods between two and nine years; customer related intangibles are amortized over periods between five and nine years;
	and developed technology is amortized over a five-year period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Company's long lived
	assets are reviewed for impairment in accordance with ASC 360-10-35, &quot;Property, Plant, and Equipment- Subsequent Measurement&quot;
	whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable. Recoverability
	of assets to be held and used is measured by a comparison of the carrying amount of the assets to the future undiscounted cash
	flows expected to be generated by the assets. If such assets are considered to be impaired, the impairment to be recognized is
	measured by the amount by which the carrying amount of the assets exceeds the fair value of the assets. Assets to be disposed
	of are reported at the lower of the carrying amount or fair value less costs to sell.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Impairment losses have
	been identified as of December 31, 2015 in the amount $0.2 million regarding other intangible assets related to the Brazilian
	transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Impairment losses have
	been identified as of December 31, 2014 in the amount of $0.3 million regarding ERP and $0.3 million regarding motor vehicles.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	No impairment losses were
	identified in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 60; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	60
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We use the income
	approach in order to determine the fair value of intangible assets, as no quoted price in active market exists for such assets.
	The income approach requires management to predict forecasted cash flows, including estimates and assumptions related to revenue
	growth rates and operating margins, future economic and market conditions. Our estimates of market segment growth and our market
	segment share and costs are based on historical data, various internal estimates and certain external sources, and are based on
	assumptions that are consistent with the plans and estimates we are using to manage the underlying business. If future forecasts
	are revised, they may indicate or require future impairment charges. We base our fair value estimates on assumptions we believe
	to be reasonable but that are unpredictable and inherently uncertain. Actual future results may differ from those estimates.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	As required by ASC
	820, &quot;Fair Value Measurements&quot; the Company applies assumptions that marketplace participants would consider in determining
	the fair value of long-lived assets (or assets groups).
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT -0.25IN; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	(b) Goodwill impairment
	test
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The company identifies
	several reporting units which are aggregated into three operative segments, the Cellocator segment, the MRM segment and the RSA
	segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	As required by ASC
	820, &quot;Fair Value Measurements&quot;, the Company applies assumptions that market place participants would consider in determining
	the fair value of each reporting unit.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We perform our annual
	impairment analysis of goodwill as of December 31 of each year, or more often if there are indicators of impairment present. We
	perform a two-step impairment test on goodwill at the level of the reporting units. In the first step, we compare the fair value
	of each reporting unit to its carrying value. If the fair value exceeds the carrying value of the net assets, goodwill is considered
	not impaired, and we are not required to perform further testing. If the carrying value of the net assets exceeds the fair value,
	then we must perform the second step, of the impairment test in order to determine the implied fair value of goodwill. To determine
	the fair value used in Step 1, we use discounted cash flows. If and when we are required to perform a Step 2 analysis, determining
	the fair value of our net assets and our off-balance sheet intangibles would require us to make judgments that involve the use
	of significant estimates and assumptions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We determined the
	fair value of each reporting unit using the income approach, which utilizes a discounted cash flow model, as we believe that this
	approach best approximates the reporting unit&rsquo;s fair value at this time. Judgments and assumptions related to revenue, operating
	income, future short-term and long-term growth rates, weighted average cost of capital, interest, capital expenditures, cash flows,
	and market conditions are inherent in developing the discounted cash flow model. The material assumptions used for the income approach
	for 2015 were 5 years of projected net cash flows, a discount rate of 13%-25% and a long-term growth rate of 3%-7.1%, and in 2014
	and 2013 the assumptions were 5 years of projected net cash flows, a discount rate of 14%-18% and a long-term growth rate of 3%-7.5%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 61; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	61
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage62"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We considered historical
	rates and current market conditions when determining the discount and growth rates to use in our analyses. If these estimates or
	their related assumptions change in the future, we may be required to record impairment charges for our goodwill.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	No impairment losses
	were identified in the years 2012 and 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We performed the annual
	goodwill impairment test as of December 31, 2014 and recorded goodwill impairment attributed to Car2Go in the total amount of $0.5
	million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We performed the annual
	goodwill impairment test as of December 31, 2015 and recorded goodwill impairment attributed to the Brazilian transaction in the
	amount $0.7 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We performed a sensitivity
	analysis for the two key assumptions used in our annual goodwill impairment test and determined that an increase in the estimated
	weighted average cost of capital of 2% and/or decrease of 1% in the long-term growth rate, would not result in the estimated fair
	value of any of the other reporting units to fall below its carrying value. Based on the sensitivity analysis, none of our reporting
	units is at risk for goodwill impairment
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLUE">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 32.2PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Other future events
	include decisions made in response to economic and competitive conditions, the impact of the economic environment on our customer
	base, or a material negative change in our relationships with significant customers. If in the future we will be required to record
	an impairment of goodwill, our results of operations could be materially harmed and our equity could be decreased.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Share based compensation
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<I>
	Stock-Based Compensation Expense.
</I>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Company applies
	ASC 718, &quot;Compensation - Stock Compensation&quot; (formerly SFAS 123(R) &quot;Share-Based Payment&quot;). In accordance with
	ASC 718, all grants of employee&rsquo;s equity based stock options are recognized in the financial statements based on their grant
	date fair values. The fair value of graded vesting options, as measured at the date of grant, is charged to expenses, based on
	the accelerated attribution method over the requisite service period of each of the awards, net of estimated forfeitures.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	During the years ended
	December 31, 2015, December 31, 2014 and December 31, 2013, the Company recognized stock-based compensation expenses related to
	employee stock options in the amounts of $309,000, $375,000 and $374,000, respectively. See Notes 2(p) and&nbsp;in our consolidated
	financial statements for additional information.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 62; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	62
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We estimated the value
	of equity employee stock options on the date of grant using a Black-Scholes option-pricing valuation model. The fair value of stock
	options awards, as determined on the date of grant, is affected by several factors including our share price, our share price volatility,
	risk-free interest rate, expected dividends and the expected term of the options. If such factors change and we employ different
	assumptions for future grants, our compensation expense may differ significantly from what we have recorded in the current period.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 24.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In addition, our compensation
	expense is affected by our estimate of the number of awards that will ultimately vest. In the future, if the number of equity awards
	that are forfeited by employees are lower than expected, the expenses recognized in such future periods will be higher.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<B>
<I>
	Income taxes
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 84PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Company accounts
	for income taxes and uncertain tax positions in accordance with ASC 740, &quot;Income Taxes&quot;. This guidance prescribes the
	use of the liability method whereby deferred tax asset and liability account balances are determined based on differences between
	financial reporting and tax bases of assets and liabilities and are measured using the enacted tax rates and laws that will be
	in effect when the differences are expected to reverse. The Company provides a valuation allowance, if necessary, to reduce deferred
	tax assets to amounts that are more likely than not to be realized.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The effect on deferred taxes of a change
	in tax rates is recognized as income in the period enacted.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 40.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Company established
	reserves for uncertain tax positions based on the evaluation of whether or not the Company&rsquo;s uncertain tax position is &quot;more
	likely than not&quot; to be sustained upon examination. As of December 31, 2015, the Company did not record any liability for uncertain
	tax positions. The Company's policy is to recognize, if any, tax related interest as interest expenses and penalties as general
	and administrative expenses. For the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company did not have any interest and penalties associated
	with tax positions
<FONT STYLE="COLOR: BLUE">
	.
</FONT>
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<B>
<I>
	Discontinued operations:
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 85.05PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: -28.35PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Under ASC 205, &quot;Presentation
	of Financial Statements - Discontinued Operation&quot; when a component of an entity, as defined in ASC 205, has been disposed
	of or is classified as held for sale, the results of its operations, including the gain or loss on its disposal are classified
	as discontinued operations and the assets and liabilities of such component are classified as assets and liabilities attributed
	to discontinued operations; that is, provided that the operations, assets and liabilities and cash flows of the component have
	been eliminated from the Company's consolidated operations and the Company will no longer have any significant continuing involvement
	in the operations of the component.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 63; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	63
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
<B>
<I>
	Recently Issued
	Accounting Standards (not effective for fiscal 2015):
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In May 2014, the FASB
	issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-09,&nbsp;Revenue from Contracts with Customers&nbsp;(Topic 606), (&quot;ASU 2014-09&quot;).&nbsp;ASU
	2014-09 requires entities to recognize revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that
	reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. It also requires
	additional disclosure about the nature, amount, timing and uncertainty of revenue and cash flows arising from customer contracts,
	significant judgments and changes in judgments, and assets recognized from costs incurred to obtain or fulfill a contract. In August&nbsp;2015,
	the FASB issued ASU 2015-14, &ldquo;Revenue from Contracts with Customers (Topic 606),&rdquo; which defers the effective date of
	ASU 2014-09 by one year to fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017 (our fiscal year 2019), including interim periods
	within that reporting period. The Company is in the process of evaluating the impact of ASU 2014-09 on its financial position and
	results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 40.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In February 2016,
	the FASB issued ASU 2016-02, &ldquo;Leases (Topic 842),&rdquo; which will replace the existing guidance in ASC 840, &ldquo;Leases.&rdquo;
	The updated standard aims to increase transparency and comparability among organizations by requiring lessees to recognize lease
	assets and lease liabilities on the balance sheet and requiring disclosure of key information about leasing arrangements. This
	ASU is effective for annual periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2018, and interim periods within those annual periods; early
	adoption is permitted and modified retrospective application is required. The Company in the process of evaluating this guidance
	to determine the impact it will have on its financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 40.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In November 2015,
	the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No.&nbsp;2015-17 (ASU 2015-17) &ldquo;Income Taxes (Topic 740): Balance Sheet Classification
	of Deferred Taxes.&rdquo; ASU 2015-17 simplifies the presentation of deferred income taxes by eliminating the separate classification
	of deferred income tax liabilities and assets into current and noncurrent amounts in the consolidated balance sheet statement of
	financial position. The amendments in the update require that all deferred tax liabilities and assets be classified as noncurrent
	in the consolidated balance sheet. The amendments in this update are effective for annual periods beginning after December&nbsp;15,
	2016, and interim periods therein and may be applied either prospectively or retrospectively to all periods presented. Early adoption
	is permitted. We have early adopted this standard in the fourth quarter of 2015 on a retrospective basis. Prior years have been
	retrospectively adjusted.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 40.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The adoption of this
	guidance is not expected to have a material effect on the Company's consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 40.5PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	For more information
	on our selected financial data, see Item 3 &ndash; Key Information &ndash; Selected Financial Data
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Analysis of our Operation Results
	for the Year ended December 31, 2015 as compared to the Year ended December 31, 2014
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues.
</I>
</B>
	Revenues decreased by $4.4 million, or 4.1%, from $105.3 million in 2014 to $100.9 million in 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The revenues from the
	sale of our products decreased by $4.5 million, or 13.5%, from $33.1 million in 2014 to $28.6 million in 2015. This decrease was
	primarily attributable to the continued price erosion of Cellocator products which affected both the Cellocator products and services
	that were bundled with Cellocator products.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 64; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	64
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The revenues from sales
	of our services increase by $0.1 million, or 0.2%, from $72.2 million in 2014 to $72.3 million in 2015. We increased the number
	of subscribers and sales in local currencies in the territories where we operate. This increase was negatively affected by the
	devaluation of these local currencies against the USD, as a result revenues from services increased only slightly.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The revenues from sales
	of our RSA services increased by $0.6 million, or 1.5%. This increase was due to increase in number of subscribers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Revenues from our MRM
	services in 2015 accounted for 60% of our total revenues, a decrease of 7.6% compared to 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Revenues from our RSA
	services in 2015 accounted for 40% of our total revenues, an increase of 1.5% compared to 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Our international revenues
	in 2015 accounted for 35.4% of total revenues compared to 33% in 2014. The increase in international sales was primarily attributable
	to an increase in the sales of MRM services in 2015. Sales to Latin America decreased from $22.1 million in 2014 to $14.3 million
	in 2015; sales to Europe decreased from $5.9 million in 2014 to $5.2 in 2015; and sales to other countries were $5.4 million in
	2015 compared to $7 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Cost of Revenues.
</I>
</B>
	Our cost of product revenues decreased by $2.3 million to $17 million for the twelve months ended December 31, 2015 as
	compared to $19.3 million for the same period in 2014. This decrease was associated with a decrease
<B>
</B>
	in revenues from Cellocator
	products.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Our cost of revenues
	from Services decreased by $0.7 million to $49.7 million for the twelve months ended December 31, 2015 as compared to $50.5 million
	for the same period in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Gross Profit
</I>
	.
</B>
	Our gross profit decreased by $1.4 million from $35.6 million in 2014 to $34.2 million in 2015. As a percentage of total revenues,
	gross profit accounted for 33.9% in 2015 compared to 33.8% in 2014. Our gross margin on Cellocator product sales in 2015 was 40.6%
	compared to 41.2% in 2014. Gross margin on services was 31.2% in 2015 compared to 29.7% in 2014. The decrease in gross profit was
	a result of decrease in revenues, but our gross margin was not affected, due to operational efficiencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Research and
	Development Costs.
</I>
</B>
	Research and development expenses in 2015 accounted for $3.4 million, similar to the same period in
	2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Selling and Marketing
	Expenses.
</I>
</B>
	Selling and marketing costs were $12.1 million in 2015 as compared to $11.2 million in 2014. This increase was
	associated with a slight increase of our sales efforts in each territory where we operate.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	General and Administrative
	Expenses.
</I>
</B>
	General and administrative expenses decreased by $1.0
<B>
</B>
	million to $10.9 million in 2015 from $11.9 million
	in 2014. This decrease was primarily attributed to the spin-off of our subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Other Expenses.
</I>
</B>
	Other expenses decreased by $0.4 million to nil in 2015 from $0.4 million in 2014. This decrease was attributed to the spin-off
	in our subsidiary.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Amortization
	of Intangible Assets.
</I>
</B>
	Amortization of intangible assets decreased by $0.3 million to $0.7 million in 2015 from $1 million
	in 2014. This decrease was primarily attributed to devaluation of the Brazilian Real against the USD.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Impairment of
	Intangible and Tangible Assets.
</I>
</B>
	Impairment of intangible and tangible assets was $0.9 million in 2015 as compared to $1.2
	million in 2014. In 2015 we recorded an impairment of intangible assets and goodwill as a result of an impairment test to our Brazilian
	investment, which was affected by the macro economic situation in Brazil. In 2014 we recorded an impairment of an ERP
<B>
</B>
	asset,
	motor vehicles held for sale and goodwill.
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Profit.
</I>
</B>
	As a result of the foregoing, we recorded in 2015 an operating income of $6.1 million, compared to an operating income
	of $6.6 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Financial Expenses
	(Net).
</I>
</B>
	Financial expenses decreased from $2.4 million in 2014 to $0.9 million in 2015. This decrease was primarily attributed
	to income from converting loans in NIS to USD, and reduction of other liabilities in foreign currencies.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Taxes on income.
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
	Taxes on income were $1.4 million expenses in 2015 compared to $(8.8) million income in 2014. In 2015 we recorded
	tax expenses related to the income generated in 2015. These expenses were offset against the deferred tax asset that was recorded
	in 2014, following the spin-off.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income
</I>
</B>
	.
	In 2015 we recorded a net income of $3.8 million, compared to a net income of $12.7 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income (Loss)
	attributable to non-controlling interests.
</I>
</B>
	We recorded net loss attributable to non-controlling interests in the amount
	of $(0.1) million in 2015, compared to net income of $0.7 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income attributable
	to Pointer shareholders.
</I>
</B>
	In 2015, we recorded net income of $3.9 million, compared to a net income of $13.5 million in
	2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Analysis of our Operation Results
	for the Year ended December 31, 2014 as compared to the Year ended December 31, 2013
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues.
</I>
</B>
	Revenues increased by $7.4 million, or 8%, from $97.8 million in 2013 to $105.3 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The revenues from
	the sale of our products decreased by $1.6 million, or 5%, from $34.7 million in 2013 to $33.1 million in 2014. This decrease
	was primarily attributable to a decrease in the volume of our Cellocator products due to loss of two customers with low margins.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The revenues from sales
	of our services increase by $9 million, or 14%, from $63.2 million in 2013 to $72.2 million in 2014. The increase was primarily
	attributable to an increase in revenues from our MRM segment provided in each of the Brazilian market (which results have been
	consolidated since October 2013), the Israeli market internal growth and the South African market (which results have been consolidated
	since October 2014), in addition to the devaluation of the average exchange rate of the NIS against the dollar by 12%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The revenues from sales
	of our RSA services increased by $1 million, or 1.3%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Revenues from our MRM
	services in 2014 accounted for 53% of our total revenues, an increase of 6% compared to 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 67; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	67
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Revenues from our RSA
	services in 2014 accounted for 34% of our total revenues, a decrease of 2% compared to 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Our international revenues
	in 2014 accounted for 33% of total revenues compared to 29% in 2013. The increase in international sales is primarily attributable
	to an increase in the sales of MRM services in 2014. Sales to Latin America increased from $16.4 million in 2013 to $22.1 million
	in 2014; sales to Europe decreased from $8.9 million in 2013 to $5.9 in 2014; and sales to other countries were $7 million in 2014
	compared to $3.7 million in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Cost of Revenues.
</I>
</B>
	Our cost of Cellocator product revenues decreased by $1.5 million to $19.3 million for the twelve months ended December
	31, 2014 as compared to $20.8 million for the same period in 2013. This decrease is associated with a decrease of $1.6 million
	in our revenues from Cellocator products.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Our cost of revenues
	from Services increased by $5 million to $50.5 million for the twelve months ended December 31, 2014 as compared to $45.5 million
	for the same period in 2013. This increase is associated with an increase of $9 million in our revenues from services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Gross Profit
</I>
	.
</B>
	Our gross profit increased by $4 million from $31.6 million in 2013 to $35.6 million in 2014. As a percentage of total revenues,
	gross profit accounted for 33.8% in 2014 compared to 32.3% in 2013. Our gross margin on Cellocator product sales in 2014 was 41.2%
	compared to 40% in 2013. Gross margins on services were 30% in 2014 compared to 28% in 2013. We continued to face price erosion
	that was partially offset by operational efficiency and cost reduction but was mostly compensated for by an increase in volumes.
	Price erosion for our MRM/RSA segment services in the Israeli market and price reduction of the products sold by our Cellocator
	segment were each attributable to increased competition. However, this erosion and price reduction were offset by new subscribers
	and increased volumes and were the primary reasons for the increase in gross margin on revenues. We expect continuous price erosion
	in this market that may affect our gross margin and the profitability of our business. In order to offset such price erosion,
	we are working to introduce new products to the market with higher margins and continuing in our cost reduction efforts for our
	products components.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Research and
	Development Costs.
</I>
</B>
	Research and development expenses in 2014 slightly increased by $0.2 million from $3.2 million in 2013
	to $3.4 million in 2014. As a percentage of revenues from the Cellocator segment, research and development costs accounted for
	14% in 2014 compared to 13% in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Selling and
	Marketing Expenses.
</I>
</B>
	Selling and marketing costs were $11.2 million in 2014 as compared to $10.4 million in 2013. This
	increase is associated with an increase of $7.4 million in our revenues from products and services and consolidation of Brazilian
	subsidiary results which commenced October 2013 and consolidation of our South African subsidiary commenced October 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	General and
	Administrative Expenses.
</I>
</B>
	General and administrative expenses increased by $1.5 million to $11.9 million in 2014 from $10.5
	million in 2013. The increase in 2014 costs are a result of the consolidation of the South African subsidiary&rsquo;s results
	commencing October 2014 and consolidation of the Brazilian subsidiary&rsquo;s results commencing October 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 68; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	68
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Other Expenses.
</I>
</B>
	Other expenses of $0.7 million in 2014 are related to the reorganization in Shagrir. Other expenses of $0.4 million
<B>
</B>
	are related to the termination cost of the former general manager of a Pointer subsidiary in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Amortization
	of Intangible Assets and Impairment of Intangible and Tangible Assets.
</I>
</B>
	Amortization of intangible assets was approximately
	$1 in 2014, unchanged from 2013. Impairment of intangible and tangible assets was $1.2 million in 2014, due to impairment of an
	ERP
<B>
</B>
	asset, Motor vehicles held for sale and Goodwill.
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Operating Profit.
</I>
</B>
	As a result of the foregoing, we recorded in 2014 an operating income of $6.6 million, compared to an operating income
	of $6 million in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Financial Expenses
	(Net).
</I>
</B>
	Financial expenses increased from $1.1 million in 2013 to $2.4 million in 2014. The expansion is primarily attributable
	to the devaluation of the Argentinean, Mexican, Brazilian, South African and Israeli currencies against the USD.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
<B>
<I>
	Taxes
	on income. &nbsp;
</I>
</B>
	Taxes on income were $(8.8) million in 2014 compared to $1.3 million in 2013. In 2014 the tax income was
	mainly
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	due to
</FONT>
	the
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	decrease
	in valuation allowance in the amount $8.8 million following the merger of Shagrir into the company. The decrease of valuation allowance
	is related to carry forward losses of the Company that are likely to be offset against future income and other timely differences.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income
</I>
</B>
	.
	In 2014 we recorded a net income of $12.7 million, compared to a net income of $7.3 million in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income (Loss)
	attributable to non-controlling interests.
</I>
</B>
	We recorded net loss attributable to non-controlling interests in the amount
	of $(0.7) million in 2014, compared to net income of $0.9 million in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Net Income attributable
	to Pointer shareholders.
</I>
</B>
	In 2014, we recorded net income of $13.5 million, compared to a net income of $6.3 million in
	2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<B>
<I>
	Selected segment financial data
</I>
</B>
	:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Commencing January
	2008, the Company had two reportable segments: the Cellocator segment and the MRM segment.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Commencing December
	2014, following the reorganization in Shagrir, the Company has three reportable segments: the Cellocator segment, the MRM segment
	and the RSA segment. Segment reporting was retroactively adjusted to reflect those segments.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Company applies
	ASC 280, &quot;Segment Reporting Disclosure&quot;. The Company evaluates performance and allocates resources based on operating
	profit or loss. See Item 4.B &ndash; Business Overview.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The Company evaluates
	performance and allocates resources based on operating profit or loss. The accounting policies of the reportable segments are the
	same as those described in the summary of significant accounting policies in the financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Revenues.
</I>
</B>
	Revenues of the MRM segment decreased in 2015 by $2.3 million to $47.9 million from $50.2 million in 2014. MRM segment revenues
	derive from services and the sale of products relating to those services provided by the MRM segment. A portion of these products
	is obtained from our Cellocator segment and the rest is obtained from third parties. The decrease is primarily attributable to
	increased competition in sales of products that are sold bundled with services, to commercial customers.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Revenues of the
	Cellocator segment in 2015 were $19.5 million, as compared to $24.1 million in 2014. The decrease of $4.6 million or 19% in
	the revenues of the Cellocator segment is primarily attributable to continued price erosion of Cellocator products which
	affected both the Cellocator products and services that were bundled with Cellocator products. In 2015 Cellocator
	inter-segment revenues from products decreased by 13% due to a decrease in sales to our Brazilian subsidiary, as a result of
	the macroeconomic situation in Brazil as mentioned above.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Revenues of the RSA
	segment increased in 2015 by $1.4 million to $40.5 million from $39.1 million in 2014. RSA segment revenues derive from services
	and the sale of products relating to those services provided by the RSA segment.&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
<I>
	Operating
</I>
</B>
	profit
	(loss). Operating profit of the MRM segment in 2015 was $3.8 million, compared to $3.3 million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 70; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	70
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The operating income
	of the Cellocator segment in 2015 was $1.0 million, compared to an operating profit of $3.9 million in 2014. The decrease is primarily
	attributable to the decrease in revenues from Cellocator products 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The operating profit
	of the RSA segment increased by $1.4 million, from a $(0.5) million loss in 2014 to a $0.9 million profit in 2015. This increase
	is primarily attributable to a decrease in general and administrative expenses in respect with the transaction related to the spin-off
	and impairment of certain assets in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
	Impact of Exchange
	Rate Fluctuations on Results of Operations, Liabilities and Assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	Our results of operations,
	liabilities and assets were mainly impacted by the fluctuations of exchange rates between the U.S. Dollar and the New Israeli Shekel
	(&quot;NIS&quot;), and to a lesser extent between the U.S. Dollar and the Brazilian Real, the Argentine Peso, the Mexican Peso,
	the Euro and the South African Rand. For a discussion regarding the functional and reporting currency of each of our subsidiaries
	see Note 2b of our consolidated financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	Our business in
	Israel currently accounts for the majority of our MRM and RSA business and revenues. The business in Israel, the MRM and RSA services
	and activities, are mainly denominated in NIS. On the other hand, the majority of the revenues of the Cellocator segment are generated
	in U.S. Dollars with some expenses such as raw materials are mainly denominated in U.S. Dollars while some expenses such as labor
	and rental are denominated in NIS. See Item 3D- Risk Factors &ndash; &quot;We may be adversely affected by a change in the exchange
	rate of the New Israeli Shekel against the U.S. Dollar&quot; for a discussion of the risks relating to income and expenses in
	U.S. Dollars and NIS.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We believe that inflation
	in Israel and fluctuations in the U.S. Dollar - NIS exchange rate may have substantial effects on our business, and our net income.
	Increased inflation may increase our NIS costs in Israel including among others salaries of our employees in Israel, costs of communications,
	subcontractors, rental, financial expenses associated with loans related to NIS and the Israeli CPI, and other expenses, which
	are paid in New Israeli Shekels. Regarding fluctuations in the U.S. Dollar &ndash; NIS exchange rate a devaluation of the NIS against
	the U.S. Dollar will reduce our NIS denominated revenues and expenses in U.S. Dollar terms and therefore may impact negatively
	our consolidated net income (losses). Revaluation of the NIS against the U.S. Dollar will increase our NIS denominated revenues
	and expenses in U.S. Dollar terms. See Item 3D- Risk Factors for further information. Due to the potential off-set of the affects
	described above, we cannot evaluate the net impact on our results of operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During
	2015, and through February 29, 2016, the exchange rate fluctuated from a low of NIS
</FONT>
	3.761
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to the U.S. Dollar to a high of NIS
</FONT>
	4.053
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	to the Dollar. The average high and low exchange
	rates between the NIS and U.S. Dollar during the most recent six months, as published by the Bank of Israel, were as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 71; VALUE: 2 -->

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;

<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 72; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	72
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In 2011, the Israeli
	economy recorded positive inflation of approximately 2.2%, where the NIS revalued against the U.S. Dollar by approximately 4.1%.
	As a result of the revaluation of the NIS, we experienced an increase in the revenues and in the costs of our Israel operations,
	as expressed in U.S. Dollars, in 2011. In 2012, the Israeli economy recorded positive inflation of approximately 1.6%, where the
	NIS devalued against the U.S. Dollar by approximately 7.8%. As a result of the devaluation of the NIS, we experienced a decrease
	in the revenues and in the costs of our Israel operations, as expressed in U.S. Dollars, in 2012. In 2013, the Israeli economy
	recorded positive inflation of approximately 1.8%, where the NIS revalued against the U.S. Dollar by approximately 6.6%. As a
	result of the devaluation of the NIS, we experienced a decrease in the revenues and in the costs of our Israel operations, as
	expressed in U.S. Dollars, in 2013. In 2014, the Israeli economy recorded negative inflation of approximately 0.2%, where the
	NIS revalued against the U.S. Dollar by approximately 12%. As a result of the devaluation of the NIS, we experienced a decrease
	in the revenues and in the costs of our Israel operations, as expressed in U.S. Dollars. In 2015, the Israeli economy recorded
	an inflation rate of approximately 1%, and the NIS devalued against the U.S. Dollar by approximately 0.3%.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Regarding our operations
	in Brazil and the fact that Pointer Brazil's revenues are not denominated in U.S. Dollars, we believe that inflation in Brazil
	and fluctuations in the exchange rate between U.S. Dollar and Brazilian Real may have a significant effect on the business and
	overall profitability of Pointer Brazil and as a consequence, on the results of our operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	The fluctuations
	of each of the Mexican Peso, the Euro, the Indian Rupee and South African Rand are not material to our business. Devaluation of
	two or more of these currencies against the USD simultaneously, may have a material adverse effect on our business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 73; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	73
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage74"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	We are engaged from
	time to time in hedging expenses relating to foreign currency exchange rate and other transactions intended to manage the risks
	relating to foreign currency exchange rate or interest rate fluctuations. In 2013, 2012 and 2011 we entered into a foreign currency
	hedging transaction to manage risk related to salary expenses in NIS. In 2013 we entered into a foreign currency hedging transaction
	to manage risk related to Brazil transaction. In 2015 and 2014 there were no foreign currency hedging transactions. We may in
	the future undertake such transactions if management determines that such is necessary to offset the abovementioned risks. See
	Item 11- Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk for further details about our hedging activities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
<B>
<I>
	Governmental and Fiscal Policies which May Affect Our
	Business
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In
	recent years the market for vehicle leasing in Israel has grown. Employers often provide vehicles to their employees as benefits
	mainly through operating leasing companies. Such benefits are tax deductible for the employer, while the employees pay tax on the
	imported value of the car placed at their disposal. The regulations which determine the method of calculation of the imputed taxable
	value of the use of a car by an employee were recently amended and apply to cars provided to and leased by employees on end of
	January 1, 2010. Whereas under the formal rules, fixed amounts of taxable income were assigned to various categories of vehicles,
	the new regulations determine the imputed taxable income according to a certain percentage of the purchase price of the car. With
	respect to most of the car models, the new regulations result in a high amount of imputed income to the employees, as compared
	to the previous rules. This result and other new regulations may adversely affect the overall demand for vehicles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Argentina&rsquo;s ongoing
	debt crisis since 2001 has caused the government to implement fiscal and monetary policies which restricted the importation of
	goods and services, governance control of foreign currency transactions, making it extremely difficult to receive credit from the
	banks. This policy may also contribute to the volatility of the exchange rate of the U.S. Dollar against the Argentinean Peso.
	In 2015, the volatility in the local and global financial system had a negative impact on the Argentine economy, and could continue
	to adversely affect the conditions in the country in the foreseeable future. In 2015, the opposition party was elected in the Argentinean
	national elections, which further contributed to the social and economic unrest, and which led to a significant devaluation of
	the Peso relative to the U.S. Dollar.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0 0PT 0.5IN">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT: BOLD 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<TR STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 32.6PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 45.35PT">
<A NAME="V428192_20F_HTM_A_017">
</A>
	B.
</TD>
<TD>
	LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	As of December 31,
	2015, we had a positive working capital of $5.6 million, our current assets to current liabilities ratio was 118% and we had cash
	and cash equivalents of $9.3 million and an unused credit facility of $8.0 million. We believe that we have access to sufficient
	capital to meet the Company's requirements for at least the next twelve months.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Our credit facilities
	and loans contain a number of restrictive covenants that limit the operating and financial flexibility of Pointer and Shagrir Group.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<!-- FIELD: PAGE; SEQUENCE: 74; VALUE: 2 -->
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 1PT SOLID">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
<!-- FIELD: SEQUENCE; TYPE: ARABIC; NAME: PAGENO -->
	74
<!-- FIELD: /SEQUENCE -->
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS; MARGIN-TOP: 6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 12PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN: 0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<!-- FIELD: /PAGE -->
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	Our operations have
	been funded through capital contributions, bank loans, private and public placements, research and development grants from the
	Office of the Chief Scientist in Israel (&ldquo;
<B>
	OCS
</B>
	&rdquo;), the BIRD Foundation, the European Community and cash flow from
	operations. We no longer receive grants from the OCS in Israel, the BIRD Foundation or the European Community. In addition, we
	do not anticipate selling the product developed using the Bird Foundation funds (which sales would require us to pay contingent
	royalties to the foundation) and therefore, do not anticipate paying these contingent royalties.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	As a result, we expect
	to fund our operations through positive net cash provided by operating activities, capital contributions, bank loans, private and
	public placements and cash flow from our operations. These sources of liquidity consist of our long-term and short-term credit
	facilities, and our private placements with Israeli investors or foreign investors, the latest of which we consummated in March
	2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In December
<B>
</B>
	2012,
	we received a dividend from Shagrir Systems in the amount of $1.45 million. In January 2014, we received a dividend from Shagrir
	Systems in the amount of $1.5 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	As of December 31,
	2015, we had loans under long-term credit facilities (including current maturities) in the aggregate amount of approximately $13.5
	million. The credit facilities provided to us and to our subsidiary Pointer Brazil by Israelis and Brazilian banks and other sources.
	$2 million was provided to Pointer to finance part of the Pointer Brazil acquisition. Of this aggregate amount, approximately $13.2
	million are long-term loans in, or linked to, the U.S. Dollar from banks and $0.3 million are long-term loans denominated in NIS
	from banks. All the loans, credit facilities and bank guarantees provided to Shagrir Systems were assigned to Pointer as of December
	31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In January 2014, Shagrir
	Systems borrowed $11.5 million to finance the Shagrir Systems transaction.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In March 2014, Pointer
	sold ordinary shares in a private placement to certain leading institutional companies in Israel in reliance on Regulation S under
	the U.S. Securities Act of 1933, as amended. In total, Pointer sold approximately 1.13 million ordinary shares at US$9.25 per share
	for aggregate consideration of approximately $10.44 million. The funds raised in the offering were used to reduce outstanding bank
	credit facilities, for the acquisition of our South African subsidiary and for future potential acquisitions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	In July 2015, Pointer
	sold its 17,141 ordinary shares of Car2Go, representing 62.31% of the issued and outstanding share capital of Car2Go, to the Shagrir
	Group in consideration for NIS 17,141 (the par value of such shares). In addition, as part of this transaction Pointer sold to
	the Shagrir Group its shareholders loans (principal amount and accrued interest) provided to Car2Go in the total amount of approximately
	NIS 11.35 million and the Shagrir Group assumed Pointer's guarantee provided to secure Car2Go's credit line in the amount of approximately
	NIS 1.3 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	For further information
	regarding our consolidated long-term loans, loan maturity and interest rate structure; see Notes 11 and 12
<B>
</B>
	to our consolidated
	financial statements.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT: 10PT TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; MARGIN: 0PT 0; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0.5IN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
